maml:description.maml:para: Get a stream.

Gets all streams or returns a specific stream by its ID. If retrieving a specific stream, you can optionally specify its version. Without specifying it, the latest version is returned by default. When listing all streams, you can filter the results by group ID or property name.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Identifies the version of the stream. If omitted, the operation returns the latest version of the stream.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Identifies the version of the stream. If omitted, the operation returns the latest version of the stream.
View activation history.
Gets the details of activation status changes for all versions of a given stream.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Get data set fields.

Gets the list of available data set fields that you can choose to monitor in your logs for a stream configuration. To get the data sets available for a specific product, you need to specify the product ID.
Uniquely identifies the product, and allows listing data sets available for that product.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Uniquely identifies the product, and allows listing data sets available for that product.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get groups.
Gets access groups with contracts on your account. To get groups for a specific contract, you need to specify the contract ID.
Uniquely identifies the contract that belongs to a group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Uniquely identifies the contract that belongs to a group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
View history.

Gets details about all versions of a given stream. It helps you track changes between the versions of the stream, including monitored properties, logged data set fields, and log delivery destinations. Optionally, specify the values for both the `-StartVersion` and `-EndVersion` parameters to get details on all stream versions for a given range.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
View upload metrics.

Gets aggregated metrics for log file uploads, including success or failure upload counts, upload latency, and the volume of data uploaded in the stream. Set the `-Start` and `-End` dates to get metrics from a specific time range. To get the group data by time intervals, set the `-AggregationInterval` parameter.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Specifies the beginning of the time range for the metrics in the ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days before the `end` date.
Specifies the end of the time range for the metrics in the ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days after the `start` date.
Unique identifier for each group.
Specifies the time interval for metrics aggregation, either 5 minutes, an hour, or 24 hours. If omitted, this operation returns the metrics grouped in hourly intervals.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Retrieve detailed metrics. If absent, this operation returns only the `timestamp`, `streamId`, `successAttemptResponseCount`, and `failAttemptResponseCount` values.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specifies the time interval for metrics aggregation, either 5 minutes, an hour, or 24 hours. If omitted, this operation returns the metrics grouped in hourly intervals.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Specifies the end of the time range for the metrics in the ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days after the `start` date.
Unique identifier for each group.
Retrieve detailed metrics. If absent, this operation returns only the `timestamp`, `streamId`, `successAttemptResponseCount`, and `failAttemptResponseCount` values.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specifies the beginning of the time range for the metrics in the ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days before the `end` date.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Get properties by group.

Gets properties that are active on the production and staging network and available within a specific group. Run this operation to get and store the `-PropertyID` values and use them in the `New-DataStream` and `Set-DataStream` operations.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a stream.

Creates a stream configuration. Within a stream configuration, you can select properties to monitor in the stream, data set fields to collect in logs, and a destination to send these log files to. Apart from the log and delivery frequency configurations, you can decide whether to activate the stream on making the request or later using the `-Activate` switch parameter. > Note: Only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Activate a stream.

Activates the latest version of a stream. Activating a stream takes approximately an hour. Once a stream is active, and the `DataStream` behavior is enabled in Property Manager, it starts collecting data and sending log files to a destination. To stop receiving the logs, you can deactivate the stream at any time. See the `New-DataStreamDeactivation` operation for details.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Deactivate a stream.

Deactivates the latest version of a stream. Deactivating a stream means that, in approximately an hour, you stop receiving logs for the properties that this stream monitors and the stream's status changes to `DEACTIVATED`. To start receiving log files again, you can activate the stream at any time using the `New-DataStreamActivation` operation.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Delete a stream.

Deletes a deactivated stream. Deleting a stream means that you can't activate this stream again and you stop receiving logs for the properties that this stream monitors. Make sure to deactivate a stream first before deleting it. See the `New-DataStreamDeactivation` operation for details.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Edit a stream.

Updates the latest version of a stream. Running this operation creates a version of the stream that replaces the existing one. Note that only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations. You need to add the `-Activate` switch parameter when patching active streams, and optionally for inactive streams if you want to activate them upon request.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Activates the stream at the time of the request, `false` by default. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to set this member to `true`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Activates the stream at the time of the request, `false` by default. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to set this member to `true`.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Update specific aspects of a stream.

Updates selected details of an existing stream using JSON Patch syntax. Running this operation creates a stream version that replaces the current one. Currently, you can patch a stream using only the `REPLACE` operation. When updating configuration objects, such as `-Destination` or `-DeliveryConfiguration`, pass the complete object. Thanks to this, you can avoid overwriting current details with the default values for omitted parameters, such as `-Tags`, `-IploadFilePrefix`, and `-UploadFileSuffix`. Note that only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations. You need to add the `-Activate` switch parameter when patching active streams, and optionally for inactive streams if you want to activate them upon request.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Activates the stream at the time of the request, `false` by default. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to set this member to `true`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Activates the stream at the time of the request, `false` by default. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to set this member to `true`.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Uniquely identifies the stream.
